title: v2.1.47 - Major Bug Fixes and Windows Improvements
description: Claude Code v2.1.47 includes extensive fixes for Windows terminal rendering, file writing to preserve trailing blank lines, improved VS Code plan preview with auto-updates, better memory usage in long-running sessions, faster startup performance (~500ms improvement), and fixes for background agents, bash tool output on Windows, and file mention suggestions.

community_feedback.quote: Version received 20 positive reactions on GitHub (+1, laugh, hooray, heart, rocket)

title: v2.1.45 - Claude Sonnet 4.6 Support
description: Claude Code v2.1.45 adds support for Claude Sonnet 4.6, introduces SDK rate limit info types, custom spinner tips override, improved startup performance, better memory usage for large shell command output, and fixes for Agent Teams on Bedrock/Vertex/Foundry.

title: v1.3.32 - Latest VS Code Extension Release
description: Continue v1.3.32 released with updates for VS Code extension including Alpine x64, Darwin ARM64, and Linux ARM64 builds.

title: Desktop App Image Viewing Feature
description: The Claude Code desktop app shows images that Claude is viewing via its Read tool, providing visual preview of what the AI is working on without waiting for it to push code to GitHub. Users are requesting this feature for the iPhone app as well.

community_feedback.quote: Claude Code desktop app lets you see images that Claude is viewing via its Read tool, providing visual preview of what it's working on
Requesting this feature for the iPhone app as well

title: Building a C Compiler with Agent Teams
description: Anthropic engineer Nicholas Carlini developed 'agent teams' - multiple Claude Code instances working in parallel on a shared codebase. Over 2,000 sessions and $20,000 in API costs, 16 agents produced a 100,000-line Rust-based C compiler capable of building Linux 6.9 on x86, ARM, and RISC-V.

community_feedback.quote: Key insights: write extremely high-quality tests, put yourself in Claude's shoes for context, make parallelism easy, and use multiple agent roles for specialization
